8317ca18aa5e2876a1880f87ea8ba0c2 (02:20): which FastCGI module is mostly used with Apache, mod_fastcgi or mod_fcgid?
7dcff74ec1c8812f6f9ca48fc780e3e2 (02:21): mod_fcgid

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:21): mod_fcgid is like mod_fastcgi, but uses a new process management strategy, which concentrates on reducing the number of fastcgi server. or at http://fastcgi.coremail.cn/index.htm or http://paul.querna.org/journal/articles/2006/01/01/using-mod_fcgid-for-ruby-on-rails-applications
8317ca18aa5e2876a1880f87ea8ba0c2 (02:26): does mod_fcgid come with apache2 as module or do I have to install it?
8317ca18aa5e2876a1880f87ea8ba0c2 (02:27): because I can't find a webpage for it.

30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (02:54): hi, i'm having a problem getting virtual hosts (2 ip's on one host, same server name) working...
4651a4fbb52af3c944288c36ad7c873b (02:54): whats the problem Yaeyama?
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (02:54): what i need to do is, if you access it via IP a, you get one configuration, and if you access it by IP b, you get a different configuration
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (02:55): but what i find is, no matter which ip i access it as, the settings appear to be random (sometimes i get a's, sometimes i get b's)
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (02:55): I have:  Listen a.a.a.a:80  and Listen b.b.b.b:80
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (02:55): followed by : <VirtualHost a.a.a.a> ServerName foo.com   ...myconfig... </VirtualHost>
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (02:56): as well as: <VirtualHost b.b.b.b> ServerName foo.com ...myconfig... </VirtualHost>
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (02:56): am I missing something?
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (02:59): Yaeyama: use Include to make configuration changes easier, and make sure you restart apache
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (03:00): do i need a different ServerName  for each?
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (03:00): eg. i really want foo.com but perhaps foo-v1.com and foo-v2.com would be required?
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (03:00): imMute: i am doing both.
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (03:01): or, NameVirtualHost *:80  and serve on all available interfaces ?
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (03:02): imMute: the client is coming in asking for a given host on a given interface...would namevirtualhost actually work?
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (03:03): not sure, I havnt looked at your problem enough :/
30ab1a5b1ba785b0c14fa4aace16847b (03:03): heh

ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:11): i have Options ExecCGI on the right <Directory> and AddHandler cgi-script .cgi .sh .pl, so any ideas why my browser still wants to save a .pl rather than it being executed by apache?
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:12): brick: what is the first line of your .pl script?
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:12): thumbs, #!/usr/bin/perl -w
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:13): unsurprising :)
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:13): anything in the error log?
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:14): thumbs, nope.
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:14): i stopped and started apache...
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:14): always wished it would give more rationale than it does for why it'
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:14): it'd serve a file that's meant to be a program
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:16): addhandler
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (03:16): addhandler is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_mime.html#addhandler or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/mod/mod_mime.html#addhandler or part of mod_mime
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:16): that should work, paste your config
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:17): http://lithic.ath.cx:8080/tmp/httpd.conf
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:17): the problem is with /var/www/NOMAD/nomad-cgi
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:18): everything continues to *look* right to me. what i really need is a way to debug this behavior
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:20): any suggestions welcomed. :)
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:22): take out         Options None  ?
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:23): thumbs, that's a good suggestion.
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:23): nonetheless, doing so has no effect on this problem
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:23): it seems proper.
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:24): maybe my browser is overcaching
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:24): and, aha, that was the problem,
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:24): ScriptAlias /nomad-cgi/ "/var/www/NOMAD/nomad-cgi/" are those paths proper?
ae2723c5c3c9da84b0c32669c7b01e60 (03:25): thanks for your help :)

06cf5e7b7710c7830d251d9786ed5715 (03:33): Can anyone tell me how I can make my apache serve gzip compressed text to browsers properly?  Firefox just asks where to save the file when accessing files on my server ending in .txt.gz, or .tgz currently.
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (03:34): mod_gzip is http://sourceforge.net/projects/mod-gzip/ or http://schroepl.net/projekte/mod_gzip/
06cf5e7b7710c7830d251d9786ed5715 (03:34): Thanks.. You guys rock.  :)
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:35): note that some browsers don't fully support that standard, namely IE
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:35): Curtman: it might work, or not

06cf5e7b7710c7830d251d9786ed5715 (03:35): thumbs: That's okay, I mostly use my server to show logs and get help on Freenode anyway.. Doubt anyone in #xorg is using IE..  Anyone that matters anyway.  Haha
06cf5e7b7710c7830d251d9786ed5715 (03:36): mod_gzip works with apache 2.x?  It's showing apache 1.3.37 in the deps for the gentoo ebuild.
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:37): I've used it on 1.3 in the past, I can't vouch for 2.x tho
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:37): better ask someone else for a backup opinion
06cf5e7b7710c7830d251d9786ed5715 (03:37): thumbs: Okay..  Thanks anyway.
fab349e0e7caf81330aa8396739fb396 (03:42): i have my apache/php server and it dont execute the header("location: xxx.php")
fab349e0e7caf81330aa8396739fb396 (03:42): does anyone know if it is a apache conf ?
06cf5e7b7710c7830d251d9786ed5715 (03:43): Apparently apache2 has mod_deflate which handles gzip encoding. or a newer mod_gzip at http://www.gknw.de/development/apache/httpd-2.0/unix/modules/
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:45): Curtman: yup that's it
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (03:45): mod_deflate is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_deflate.html or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_deflate.html
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:45): I forgot about that one.
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:45): kaydara: that header looks suspicious
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:46): kaydara: did you set up php properly?

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (03:46): PHP is enabled (see http://www.php.net) with 'AddHandler application/x-httpd-php .php .phtml' or See http://www.php.net/manual/en/install.unix.apache2.php or See http://www.php.net/manual/en/install.unix.apache.php or for windows ask about "php on windows"
fab349e0e7caf81330aa8396739fb396 (03:46): going to read it

d288b9f052e7327c953f0817aa5b8334 (03:46): kaydara, make sure display_errors is on, and error_reporting is set to E_ALL (php), and that you've not sent any other headers first. That should make it obvious what the problem is.
fab349e0e7caf81330aa8396739fb396 (03:47): the_angry_angel that conf are on php right ?
3613fbfec191bde6ead3934d207784bb (03:47): If my php module fails to load during apache's launch, any .php file is left 'unprotected' and its source code can be downloaded as plain text by any visitor
fab349e0e7caf81330aa8396739fb396 (03:47): going to check that, erros messages are nice
3613fbfec191bde6ead3934d207784bb (03:47): is there any way to avoid that?
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:48): oliverp: make the php module load properly
